MasterCSS.assistant.assistant module¶

class MasterCSS.assistant.assistant.SampleAssistant(language_code, device_model_id, device_id, conversation_stream, display, channel, deadline_sec, device_handler)¶

Bases: object

Sample Assistant that supports conversations and device actions.

Params device_model_id

identifier of the device model.

Params device_id

identifier of the registered device instance.

Params conversation_stream(ConversationStream)

audio stream for recording query and playing back assistant answer.

Params channel

authorized gRPC channel for connection to the Google Assistant API.

Params deadline_sec

gRPC deadline in seconds for Google Assistant API call.

Params device_handler

callback for device actions.

assist(text_query=None)¶

Send a voice request to the Assistant and playback the response.

Returns

True if conversation should continue.

Return type

boolean

Yields: AssistRequest messages to send to the API.

MasterCSS.assistant.audio_helpers module¶

Helper functions for audio streams.

class MasterCSS.assistant.audio_helpers.ConversationStream(source, sink, iter_size, sample_width)¶

Bases: object

Audio stream that supports half-duplex conversation.

A conversation is the alternance of: - a recording operation - a playback operation

Excepted usage:

For each conversation: - start_recording() - read() or iter() - stop_recording() - start_playback() - write() - stop_playback()

When conversations are finished: - close()

Params source

file-like stream object to read input audio bytes from.

Params sink

file-like stream object to write output audio bytes to.

Params iter_size

read size in bytes for each iteration.

Params sample_width

size of a single sample in bytes.

close()¶

Close source and sink.

property playing¶
read(size)¶

Read bytes from the source (if currently recording).

property recording¶
property sample_rate¶
start_playback()¶

Start playback to the audio sink.

start_recording()¶

Start recording from the audio source.

stop_playback()¶

Stop playback from the audio sink.

stop_recording()¶

Stop recording from the audio source.

property volume_percentage¶

The current volume setting as an integer percentage (1-100).

write(buf)¶

Write bytes to the sink (if currently playing).

class MasterCSS.assistant.audio_helpers.SoundDeviceStream(sample_rate, sample_width, block_size, flush_size)¶

Bases: object

Audio stream based on an underlying sound device.

It can be used as an audio source (read) and a audio sink (write).

Params sample_rate

sample rate in hertz.

Params sample_width

size of a single sample in bytes.

Params block_size

size in bytes of each read and write operation.

Params flush_size

size in bytes of silence data written during flush operation.

close()¶

Close the underlying stream and audio interface.

flush()¶
read(size)¶

Read bytes from the stream.

property sample_rate¶
start()¶

Start the underlying stream.

stop()¶

Stop the underlying stream.

write(buf)¶

Write bytes to the stream.

MasterCSS.assistant.audio_helpers.align_buf(buf, sample_width)¶

In case of buffer size not aligned to sample_width pad it with 0s

MasterCSS.assistant.audio_helpers.normalize_audio_buffer(buf, volume_percentage, sample_width=2)¶

Adjusts the loudness of the audio data in the given buffer.

Volume normalization is done by scaling the amplitude of the audio in the buffer by a scale factor of 2^(volume_percentage/100)-1. For example, 50% volume scales the amplitude by a factor of 0.414, and 75% volume scales the amplitude by a factor of 0.681. For now we only sample_width 2.

Params buf

byte string containing audio data to normalize.

Params volume_percentage

volume setting as an integer percentage (1-100).

Params sample_width

size of a single sample in bytes.

Helper functions for the Device Actions.

class MasterCSS.assistant.device_helpers.DeviceRequestHandler(device_id)¶

Bases: object

Asynchronous dispatcher for Device actions commands. Dispatch commands to the given device handlers.

Register a device action handlers.

Parameters

Parameters

Submit device command executions.

Parameters
